text.__SUMMARY__: Tibersyrnola unifasciata is a species of sea snail, a marine gastropod mollusk in the family Pyramidellidae, the pyrams and their allies.
text.Description: The shell is smooth and polished. It is white, with a median, narrow, light chestnut band. The teleoconch contains 11 flattened whorls. The length of the shell varies between 3 mm and 6.5 mm.
text.Distribution:
This marine species occurs in rather deep water (200m - 700m) in the following locations:
European waters (ERMS scope)
Greek Exclusive Economic Zone
Portuguese Exclusive Economic Zone (the Azores)
Spanish Exclusive Economic Zone
United Kingdom Exclusive Economic Zone
Canary Islands
Atlantic Ocean off Mauritania
text.Notes:
Additional information regarding this species:
Habitat: Known from seamounts and knolls
text.References: Micali P., Nofroni I. & Smriglio C. (2014) Odostomia crassa Jeffreys, 1884 junior synonym of Tibersyrnola unifasciata (Forbes, 1844), new combination (Gastropoda Pyramidellidae). Biodiversity Journal 5(2): 209–212
